title: Ground stations as-a-service struggle to gain foothold in military market
summary: Despite a capacity crunch, industry executives say the military is not taking advantage of ground stations that are provided as a commercial service.

title: Isar Aerospace Completes 260-Second Hot Fire Test
summary:
German launch startup Isar Aerospace has announced significant progress with the development of its Aquila rocket engine. The company has confirmed that flight versions of the engine are currently being manufactured. Isar is developing Spectrum, a 28-metre tall two stage launch vehicle that is designed to carry up to 1,000 kilograms to low Earth orbit. […]
The post Isar Aerospace Completes 260-Second Hot Fire Test appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Russia renamed its ambitious satellite program after Putin misspoke its name
summary: "So I didn't even make it back and it's already renamed to Sfera."

title: Daily Telescope: Meet the Flying Bat and Squid nebulae
summary: The Squid Nebula is a recent discovery, first spotted in 2011.

title: New agreement enables U.S. launches from Australian spaceports
summary: The governments of Australia and the United States have signed an agreement that could allow American rockets to launch from Australian spaceports, although it is unclear how much demand there is for them.
